importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the plane crash, which occurred on September 18, 2025, marks a tragic event in aviation safety and highlights the importance of clear communication between pilots and air traffic control.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The article was updated at 5:44 PM EDT on October 20, 2025, indicating the latest available information on the NTSB's preliminary report regarding the crash.

keyTakeAways: Brett James, a Grammy-winning songwriter known for his work with Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina.
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the plane entered a 'tightening spiral' during flight, leading to a crash that killed all three people on board.
James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which was approved by air traffic control, but failed to change to the common traffic advisory frequency, resulting in a loss of communication.
The plane, a Cirrus SR22T, flew over the runway and descended into a left turn before the spiral, with no mechanical issues identified in the wreckage.
James was a prominent collaborator in country music, with major hits like 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' co-written with Hillary Lindsay and Gordie Sampson, which helped launch Carrie Underwood's career.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Grammy-winning songwriter Brett James, known for his collaborations with major music artists like Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, and Kenny Chesney, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina. The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the Cirrus SR22T aircraft he was piloting entered a 'tightening spiral' after failing to switch to the common traffic advisory frequency, resulting in lost communication with air traffic control. The plane had been approved for a visual approach to runway 7, but James never changed frequencies, and no mechanical issues were found in the wreckage. The incident underscores the importance of pilot-radio communication in aviation safety and marks a tragic loss in the music industry.
title: Songwriter Brett James’ plane entered a ‘tightening spiral’ before crashing, the NTSB said in a preliminary report
